The class {{tt|weekday}} represent a day of the week in the {{enwiki|proleptic Gregorian calendar}}. Its normal range is {{closed range plain|0|6}}, for Sunday through Saturday, but it can hold any value in the range {{closed range plain|0|255}}. Seven named constants are predefined in the {{tt|std::chrono}} namespace for the seven days of the week.

{{tt|weekday}} is a {{named req|TriviallyCopyable}} {{named req|StandardLayoutType}}.

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::chrono::weekday x{42 / 13};
    std::cout &lt;&lt; x++ &lt;&lt; '\n';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; x &lt;&lt; '\n';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; ++x &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
Wed
Thu
Fri
}}
